reviews.title: Good for the price, but not great
reviews.text: MontBleu is a nice place and the rooms are very spacious. However, I agree with other reviews that they are in great need of renovation. I did not find the front desk clerk particularly helpful at check in. Did not even point out the elevator and I had to find it myself. According to Expedia, rooms have a deep soaking tub and come in either a king of two beds. Apparently double beds only have a regular tub though. Luckily we were moved without any problems but ended up in a lower floor with no view. The king bedded room is pretty large compared to other hotels' standard rooms. It has a very nice and large round Roman tub for romantic getaways. The bathroom overall is also pretty big. Housekeeping seemed to do a good job, room was very clean. But overall, the rooms are worn and tired, some of the curtains are stained. They need to remodel. Room service seemed greatly overpriced. I ordered dinner the first night and it was as expensive as a classy restaurant, but the food was not worth the price. Their buffet closed an hour later than advertised and room service started serving their limited "late night" menu earlier than advertised. I did have breakfast every morning of our stay and it was good, though still a bit pricey. I was there to ski so did not gamble nor used the spa. Starbucks on the premises was very convenient, but expect to pay more than what you would pay at a stand alone store. Through expedia, we managed to get a rate of

reviews.text: I stayed at MontBleu/Caesars Tahoe yesterday and the experience was AMAZING. The staff was extremely friendly and the food was excellent! The cafe called 20 Four has the best onion rings and I would highly recommend the lobster sandwich and banana fritters. For breakfast try the yogurt parfait. The hotel smelled clean and fresh, unlike other hotels in the region and the remodel has given the resort a major facelift from frumpy to sexy and stylish. My room was comfortable and the view of the mountains and Lake Tahoe were breathtaking. I would highly recommend my friends and family to stay here. I'm from Vegas and this hotel reminds me of the cool Vegas resorts but with a warm, cozy and friendly atmosphere.

reviews.text: Yes, the hotel is under construction, but it does not hamper the hospitality of the hotel in any way. It is a very nice hotel, about the same as the others in the area. The casino is much nicer than the others there at Stateline, in that it has a whole lot more room. The new lobby bar is very nice. The concierge was very helpful in setting up our plans. The rooms were very nice. The Mexican restaurant was very good, and the buffet was okay - about what you get a buffet!

reviews.title: STAY FAR AWAY FROM CAESARS TAHOE
reviews.text: Not only is this property no longer "Caesars" - here are a few things you should know that you will NOT BE NOTIFIED of when you call or book online. This property is completely under construction - changing from Caesars to "Mont Bleu", doesn't matter what the new name will be... I will never return to this place. As previous reviews state, the room rate is at the discretion of the operator you happen to talk to - though the rate may not be consistent, one thing is - no matter who you talk to, they will be rude. The casino area of the property is full of tape and dust - full construction, there is 1 bathroom that is actually open and functioning for all casino guests. Another thing they neglect to notify guests of in advance is that only 2 of the advertised restaurants are even open, yep, you got it - all the others are closed for construction. After 2 nights of this, I had finally had enough - I spoke with the property manager, who explained the mess this way - when I asked why I wasn't informed of this "work in progress before I booked 3 nights at $189 per night". My answer? "We have been given explicit instructions by the new owner not to give any information about our remodeling to guests before they arrive".. (ie; by the time you get here, you're stuck, deal with it.) (It is important to note that Tahoe is a 1 hour drive from the Reno airport)

reviews.title: Awesome Remodel- Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The MontBleu is fun, pretty stylish, with plenty to do and see. But it is definitely not four star. Our room was very outdated, although there were nice touches (aveda amenities, hot tub, fairly modern bedding). The hallways were so old. The casino itself smelled pretty foul- but we thought it smelled WAY better than other casinos! The casino was pretty calm, as well, in comparison to others, which we appreciated. The hotel has done an excellent job in designing the new elements- the signage is very funky, the restaurants are fun and modern, etc. But, I feel like they should have shut the whole place down and really remodeled. Another note- the spa (with sauna, steam room, showers, etc.) had children in it. I had used the spa at the Hyatt in Incline Village, thankfully, because the spa at Montbleu needs some attention. We ate at Lew Mar Nel, down by the water and away from all the chaos. It was the highlight of our trip- please please please go! It was the kind of restaurant you always hope to find- fairly affordable, really great food, amazing service, wonderful atmosphere! Go to MontBleu and have a great time- just don't go with really high expectations.

They do not allow ski equipment in the rooms (there is an equipment desk somewhere in the hotel - we stored our gear in our car), so I think that helps the rooms stay in better shape.

reviews.text: I loved Montbleu and can't wait to go back! No doubt, it is a work in progress, but what an improvement over the other hotels in the area. They seem to attract an older crowd, while Montbleu is appealing to a younger crowd. The colors, restaurants, music, etc...all very young and hip. If I had not known better, I would have thought I was in a hip hotel in Las Vegas! We really loved the place. The rooms need some work, you can tell they have not gotten to them yet, as they are dated with the old Ceasers feel to them....but, they were clean. Only real complaints was the place is still under remodel and not everything was open. The Blu club was never opened while we were there, and we really wanted to go to it. Cierra Steak House was wonderful with an excellent hostess and staff. All of the staff in the hotel was very welcoming. Some very minimal problems were no CD player in the rooms, the towels are very old and small, and the hotel hallways do smell of smoke. Being a non-smoker, we noticed lots of smoking of cigs and cigars that lingered....but, that was not a big deal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms -- I've stayed in the Premium room category on the pet floor (we've stayed at the hotel with our dog -- it costs $35 extra and comes with a Montbleu pet tag and some treats). The premium rooms are remodeled and are very nice. Yes, the bathrooms could be updated (especially the towels), but all in all, I've enjoyed the rooms -- especially the Aveda toiletries and free wi-fi access. If you leave a nice tip for the housekeeper and request extra toiletries, it's well worth it! On only one occasion did we get an older, unremodeled room -- I suspect that the poor reviews below are for that category of room. If room quality is really important, make sure to request a premium room that has been remodeled. Keep in mind that you're most likely to get the room that you want if you arrive on a weekday or early afternoon/evening on Friday. If you get there really late on Friday or arrive on a Saturday, you may not be able to get one of the better rooms.

Paid about $120 a night but hey, you can win that back in one blackjack hand :)

reviews.title: We'll Stay Here Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: What was quite atrocious was that the following morning, and twice, may I add, housekeeping barged into the room, once before 9am and the second time just past 9am. My husband and I had been to a late night musical the night before and expected to be able to sleep in that morning - we weren't too pleased to say the least. To top it all off, at 11am the phone rang and a lady from housekeeping barked whether we wanted more towels (?). We told her that housekeeping could come by later. They never showed up and the bed was not bed nor toiletries replenished.
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel in a beautiful place.

likes.disliked: — Having to climb into the spa tub to take a shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service at the concierge was tired and grudging when we approached to ask about the lake tahoe cruises. We decided to probe no further and just drive to the ticket office itself to enquire. The 24 restaurant was ok but the menu was not exciting - sandwiches and the like.
reviews.title: Generally very nice with some bumps
